metadata.title: Kim Jong Un says his ‘heart aches’ over North Korean soldiers killed fighting for Russia, in rare admission of losses

left: Kim Jong Un awarded medals to North Korean combatants and commanders who fought for Russia.
Around 600 North Koreans have been killed and over 4,000 wounded while fighting for Russia, according to South Korea's intelligence agency.
Kim said his 'heart aches' over the North Korean soldiers killed, calling them 'martyrs' in a rare admission of losses.
center: Kim Jong Un awarded medals to North Korean combatants and commanders who fought for Russia.
Around 600 North Koreans have been killed and over 4,000 wounded while fighting for Russia, according to South Korea's intelligence agency.
Kim said his 'heart aches' over the North Korean soldiers killed, calling them 'martyrs' in a rare admission of losses.
right: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un expressed sorrow for the heroic North Korean troops killed fighting for Russia in Ukraine. He stated his heart aches over their losses, according to KCNA.
During a ceremony, Kim decorated soldiers and honored fallen troops by laying flowers at a memorial wall.
Kim recognized the bravery of North Korean troops who participated in the war against Ukraine, stating their actions proved the army's power.
Approximately 600 North Korean troops have died out of 15,000 deployed to fight for Russia, as reported by South Korean lawmakers.
